name: undecane
source: American Petroleum Institute. Research Project 44; Selected Values of Properties of Hydrocarbons and Related Compounds. Texas A & M University; College Station; TX; 1973.
Reason: 1,1-Undecan is a saturated hydrocarbon with a melting point of -10.5°C. The basic unit for comparison can be n-heptane, which has a melting point of -10.0°C. The additional functional groups and structural features in 1,1-undecan will affect its melting point: (1) The presence of 11 contiguous carbon atoms increases the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure, contributing approximately +100°C; (2) The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, reducing the symmetry and increasing the molecular volume, estimated at around +20°C; (3) The two phenyl groups add rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +30°C each.
